ResourceHeader.Description:
NASA's Explorer 35 spacecraft, also known as
  Anchored IMP B (AIMP B) and as IMP E, was launched into a lunar-
  centric elliptical orbit in July, 1967.  Apogee was about 5 lunar radii
  and the period was about 12 hours.  Measurements of thermal
  plasma, energetic particles, magnetic fields and solar X-rays
  were made. Explorer 35 was a spin-stabilized spacecraft and
  the spin axis direction was nearly perpendicular to
  the ecliptic plane, and the spin rate was 25.6 rpm.
  The spacecraft was turned off in June, 1973.
